title: Antoninus (turncoat)
text:
Antoninus (<a href="Ancient%20Greek">Greek</a>: Άντονίνoς) was a member of the <a href="Late%20Roman%20army%23Scholae">Household Cavalry</a> under Emperor <a href="Constantius%20II">Constantius II</a>, and later an advisor to the <a href="Sasanian%20Empire">Sasanian</a> king (<a href="shah">shah</a>) <a href="Shapur%20II">Shapur II</a>. He played a key role in providing <a href="Military%20intelligence">intelligence</a> to the shah, culminating in the <a href="Looting">sack</a> of <a href="Siege%20of%20Amida">Amida</a> in 359 AD.
Life.
<a href="Ammianus%20Marcellinus">Ammianus Marcellinus</a> is the only source on Antoninus:
Ammianus then goes on to describe how Antoninus had been mistreated by the imperial authorities of <a href="Constantius%20II">Constantius II</a>. Having grown tired of losing property and wealth to corruption, Antoninus decided to become <a href="turncoat">turncoat</a>. After contacting the <a href="Sasanian%20Empire">Sasanian</a> authorities, he crossed the <a href="Tigris">Tigris</a> river and joined Sasanians. Antoninus later met <a href="Ursicinus%20%28magister%20equitum%29">Ursicinus</a> in the turn of events leading to the <a href="siege%20of%20Amida">siege of Amida</a>. Ammianus (who was present) noted how Antoninus had come to adopt the dress and customs of the Sasanian <a href="Court%20%28royal%29">court</a>. 
There is nothing else known about Antoninus' life, aside from the high position in the court of <a href="Shapur%20II">Shapur II</a>. This may in part have been because he spoke both <a href="Ancient%20Greek">Greek</a> and <a href="Latin">Latin</a>.
